basic_data.name: The Bar at Shangri-La Hotel Toronto

reviews.title: Classy jazz evening
text: Was trying to look up a place for a place to wind down for the Friday evening and realized that Shangri-La has live music from 8ish onwards to close. So we headed there, its acoustic live jazz with intermission in between. For the free music, the steep drink prices were justified... ~$18+ for a cocktail and the fact that it was a hotel bar.
Would come here again - didn't have a chance to try their food but had their dessert of Eton Messe.

reviews.title: elegant -
text: This is my 2nd time at this bar and absolutely will come back again. Located in the lobby of The Shangri-La Hotel, in Toronto, is hip and chic. People are very well dressed and the high class atmosphere, top flight service make it worth to visit. A great place to cool off or as adult lounge to enjoy a few drinks before going to the next spot. Friday nite crowd with DJ was fantastic for us to stop in for a drink after our dinner at next door restaurant.

reviews.title: Great service
text: I love that the bar changes things up every now and again with their wine lists and live music. The service is exceptional and the ambiance is lovely. Great spot for a glass of wine after the ballet or theatre.
It’s tricky to chat at times with the live music but overall a lovely spot

reviews.title: Nice spot to have a drink
text: We were staying at the hotel, so actually went to The Bar a couple times.  Friday night was VERY busy, but they were able to get us on a big table with some other patrons.  Service was a little slow, but it was busy, and some of the drinks the bartenders were making were quite time-consuming!  As it got later into the evening, it was less busy, and service was excellent.
Great atmosphere, nice place to 'people watch', and prices were reasonable.
Kudos to the one bartender - can't remember his name, but he was tall, slim, with a shaved head - who really provided excellent service.
Would certainly recommend this place.

reviews.title: Classy and Musical!
text: Arrived early before they start the live piano music.  We sat near the piano and enjoyed the live performance.  The service was prompt and courteous.  The place is quite popular and the drinks are good, with never ending servings of snacks!

reviews.title: Sexy, stylish spot for cocktails in down town Toronto, Canada
text: This bar/lounge, located in the lobby of The Shan-Gri-La Hotel, in the heart of downtown Toronto, is hip, always happening on weekends and even has a little jazz band playin live tunes Fri through Sat in the entrance way! Clientelle is well dressed and the drinks are pricey (min $20.00 CAN per cocktail) but the high class atmosphere, top quality service and sophisticated adult crowd make it worth the extra cost. A great place for a first date, or any kind of romantic engagement, or simply effective as a snazzy, adult-centric lounge to enjoy a few pre-drinks before hoppin'to the next spot.

reviews.title: Wait..Wait...Wait some more!
text: Awesome from the outside, piano player but sat and waited for Service.  We waited and waited and finally got up and left.  3:00PM ....no reason.

reviews.title: Febreeze in the air and loud (lousy?) music
text: This is the lobby bar of a high end hotel. The place smells of Febreeze, but worse is the music which is always overly loud and the recent acoustic guitar player was often off key. Hard to have a conversation Just turn the volume down 'cause the room's not that big.

reviews.title: Beautiful Setting for Nightcap or Dessert
text: We visited the Shangri-La lobby lounge after dinner. The setting is remarkable and the people watching is excellent. Cocktails and dessert were exceptional. Only minor complaint was the service- a little slow for our liking, and we had to request the dessert menu. Given the quality of the dessert offerings, we felt the menu should be readily accessible. Overall wonderful experience.

reviews.title: The spot to be in Toronto
text: This is a cool hangout spot for the locals. It has a sit down bar and númerous other quaint seating areas where one can have drinks with friends or family etc. Many awesome eateries are with in walking distance of this chic stop. A great sushi restaraunt is located just outside.

reviews.title: 5 Star For Sure
text: Came for drinks with friends late on a Tuesday night post dinner. Group of 6. Lobby bar virtually empty upon arrival.

Greeted by the enticing floral scented air in the lobby. Just heavenly. Attentive service to take our drink order, but drinks took a long time to arrive. Appreciated the linen service. Slow to bring munchies. Drinks are quite expensive, so we expect better service, especially when it's not busy.

Beautiful lobby, very pleasing to the eye. Last call was a midnight, wish the lobby bar was open the additional hour to 1:00 AM. Guest washroom very clean, and amenities well stocked. Beautiful marble throughout. Appreciated this as the facilities at Trump were terribly filthy. At a 5 star, facilities should be tidy and spotless.
We just ordered drinks, didn't order food.
I find the Toronto Shangri-la lobby bar to be a novelty amongst Toronto's new crop of 5 star hotels. I'd go back to try the food or to take clients or friends and overall I recommend it.

reviews.title: They were having a bad night in the lobby bar
text: We went to meet another couple in the lobby of the Shangri-La for a few drinks last night.  The decor and ambience was nice, and the band was a nice touch.  The waitresses, howver, were finding it a struggle to do their jobs.  We waited anywhere from 10-20 minutes for each drink and they had consisently forgotten our orders.  I went to the bathroom twice, and athough, they were nice facilities, the stalls were missing toilet paper, and this was after housekeeping was in.  When the time came for the bill, the waitresses had given us somebody else's bill, which, at this point wasn't a surprise.  The girl seemed to struggle with the merchant machine as well.  I understand that people make mistakes and drop the ball from time-to-time, but these girls were consistent.  It appears that they weren't trained well, or were understaffed, but regardless of why, I expected a better experience.

reviews.title: Average yet expensive
text: The hotel's bar is nicely decorated and the staff is very attentive and quick. Lots of escorts roaming around hunting for rich businessmen. Drink prices are ridiculously expensive. Save your cash, go to another downtown bar.

reviews.title: Great Spot - Cool scene
text: Love the Bar here, great music each and every night and so much variety.
Celebrity hangout and just a very inspot for Toronto nightlife.
Give yourself a treat and stop in, I love it!

reviews.title: Cool spot to hang out with a drink, but WOW!!
text: Stopped in for a drink enjoyed a little piano entertainment. Nice atmosphere, good music, but $40 for a Stella and a Cosmo?

reviews.title: Restaurant / Bar
text: Food and service is good. A bit noisy the way it is located though. Servers are not that attentive to the customer. Customer service could be better for the rating of the hotel and location.

reviews.title: Drinks and music
text: Come to enjoy some drinks in a fantastic bar. The live band was excellent and drinks flowed all night. Reserve a table ahead of time because it was busy

reviews.title: Just good as always
text: Well shangri-la hotels are just awesome, decorations staff food service is just too notch, so besides all that the hotel is centrally located with a very good chinese kind of restaurant next door. The facilities are excellent. The breakfast is out of the world. The concierge service was just perfect...and the rooms were shangri-la expectations and more, so it's not cheap but worth it.

reviews.title: vibrant bar scene
text: Comfortable high quality furnishings, very good table service, properly made drinks, live entertainment. We went for pre-dinner cocktails before dining elsewhere and then returned briefly afterwards. It was busy and had a great atmosphere.

reviews.title: Excellent and interesting
text: We went for drinks in the lobby bar and loved it!  Fantastic live music and a selection of drinks and snacks that were amazing.  I am totally addicted to their cheese selection.  We had dinner at the restaurant the night before and loved it so much we came back for snack the next night.  The Pinot was perfect and the ambiance is wonderful.  Hani Roustom always makes us feel very welcome and we will definitely be back.

reviews.title: Stunning Design, Sad Service, Bad Dessert
text: After dining in Momofuku, my friends pulled up a seat in the lobby bar for post dinner cocktail and dessert.
The Good: The Atmosphere is excellent. Someone has gone to a lot of trouble to ensure that the design of the lounge and the music (live and piped) was in sync.

The Bad: The Service was poor, and not very attentive. It lacked follow-up to see if we wanted additional beverages (we did, no one asked, so we didn’t order additional) or if our desserts were good (They weren’t).

The Ugly: The desserts. It really was the saddest example I’ve seen in a long time of someone trying so hard to create art on a plate (which they didn’t achieve either) that they forget the simple point of dessert. Be Decedent. Be that little guilty pleasure that I scrape my fork unabashed against the plate to get the last little bits of flavor. My advice: Rip the dessert menu out, start from scratch. You’re a luxury hotel, make sure your lobby bar staff are attentive enough that the $15 to $22 dollar cocktails you’re trying to sell to your clients they are able to buy.

reviews.title: False front
text: Good from far but far from good. The chef needs to know how to cook rice thoroughly. Also, don't roll the wasabi into a tight little ball resembling a small booger. It was impossible to dissolve into the soy sauce. I highly suggest the chef go to Chinatown to learn how to properly make Har Gow. Btw, the calamari was the worst I've ever had and it used the same Cajun spice as the table popcorn. What a travesty. Shame.
